intro: Lepidadenia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth lepidadenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
